conclusion: The graph shows the relationship between x (position) on the vertical axis in meters and t² (time squared) on the horizontal axis in s².
At t² = 0, x = 6 m; at t² = 2 s², x = 0 m; the relationship appears to be linear.

premise: The graph is a straight line, and the general equation for a straight line is x = mx(t²) + b.
conclusion: The equation of the line can be written as x = mx(t²) + b, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept.

premise: From the graph, b = 6 m (position at t² = 0).
conclusion: The y-intercept of the line is b = 6 m.

premise: The slope of the line can be calculated as m = (0 - 6)/(2 - 0).
conclusion: The slope of the line is m = -6/2 = -3 m/s².

premise: The slope and y-intercept are known: m = -3 and b = 6.
conclusion: The equation of the line is x = -3t² + 6.

premise: The equation of the line x = -3t² + 6 gives position as a function of t².

conclusion: The velocity function is v(t) = dx/dt = d(-3t² + 6)/dt = -6t.
The acceleration function is a(t) = dv/dt = d(-6t)/dt = -6 m/s².
The magnitude of acceleration is |a| = |-6| = 6 m/s².
